Note:
This hymn was later combined with 2899 in an expanded version, 5077; cf. also 2900 and 2936. The quatrain (=stanza 14 of London, British Library Harley 2253) appears separately as ‘Ora pro Anglia, Sancta Maria, quod Thomas Cantuaria’, in some early prints of Chaucer; cf. Purves (1870)
XPurves, David Laing. The Canterbury Tales and Faerie Queene. Edinburgh: Nimmo, 1870, 292; & Gilman (1879)
XGilman, . The Poetical Works of Geoffrey Chaucer. Boston: Houghton, Osgood, 1879, 3.655.
Subjects: hymns, to Christ; Christ, hymns to
_description: A hymn based on the Iesu dulcis memoria — fifteen monorhyming quatrains

BodDig86.First Lines:
Swete ihesu king of blisseMin herte loue min herte
                    lisse…
BodDig86.Last Lines:
…Of þi loue þat is so swoteAnd wite hit þat hit
                    springe mote

CamFitz355a.First Lines:
Swete ihesu heuene kingffayr & best of alle
                    thyng…
CamFitz355a.Last Lines:
…Þou bringe us owt of þis moringTo come to þe
                    at owre ending
CamFitz355a.Note: Stanza 14 of London,  British Library Harley 2253 version only; follows 6299

BLHar2253.First Lines:
Suete Iesu king of blyssemyn huerte loue min huerte
                    lisseþou art suete myd ywisse…
BLHar2253.Last Lines:
…þe vnderfonge in fourme of bredant seþþe to
                    heouene þou vs led
